notes.text: We live in Merida, yucatan state, Mexico, but will be moving back as soon as we know what our options are to buy back in the Fraser valley. We will have between $90,000 and $550,000 on arrival (depending on when our house here sells).
SV-  Setting a time to finish application with client and proceed.

SV- Hi Stephanie,

I was given your contact information from Colleen Romano, whom I used to work with at Coast Capital Savings back in the day.

This is a bit of a long read, so I apologize for that, but I need to provide a lot of info / context before asking my questions.

Me and my family have been living in the Yucatan state, Mexico, for about a year and a half now, but have our house here up for sale and are wanting to come back to BC, specifically the Fraser Valley where we’re originally from. 

If we come back before the house sells, we will have around 100k at our disposal for a down payment situation and I will have full time work right away, while my spouse will be working part time. 

My question is:
Would we be able to qualify for any type of mortgage with you, without having to work for “x” amount of time for proof of income?  Yes this is possible  I ask because we are a family of 4 with a large breed dog, and to come back and work for say 3-6 months and pay rent would be incredibly difficult with the cost of rent these days, not to mention the fact that we have a large dog with us as well, so our selection is verrrrry limited on who would even let us rent from them. - Agree, I have 2 dogs myself.  What kind of dog do you have?   

Like I said, I will have full time work right away and will have minimum 100k down right away, and when our house in Mexico sells we would be getting between $500-600k in additional funds, of which we would obviously put straight down on whatever mortgage we have.   This will help with a large down payment as it plays a big part in affordability ratios.   When is your first day at work?  Will you be on probation?  I have helped clients who had no work and was on probation.    It just really depends on the overall situation. 

We’ve talked to one other broker who mentioned us possibly being able to have a higher rate mortgage, with higher payments for the first 6 months or something, which we would choose over renting if that’s the only option..it’s just our biggest obstacle is coming back to Canada, we will have nowhere to stay for the time period needed to provide proof of income on a traditional mortgage.   Are you still working with the broker?  We work with many lenders from A lender, B lenders and private lenders.   There are many options.    Would you like to find a place and have it ready to move in when you arrive?  Or do you want to start shopping when you arrive.   Your situation is unique.   Are you willing to pay for rent for  a month or so?  It will give you some time to find a place in person?   It really depends on the loan to value ) how much down payment and if there is equity.  The broker is probably suggesting to go through a private lender till your work settles and then switch after 3 to 6 months.  It's really best to discuss over the phone. 

I will mention that we *might* have my father in law as an option for a co-signer on a mortgage, but we haven’t fully discussed that with him yet and we would ideally prefer, if possible, to do this on our own.   I can look at options on your own first, if needed, we can add your father in law as a co signer or a guarantor.   I understand that you want to try on your own first.  Only makes sense, it's a challenge when adding co signers or when family is involved. 

Colleen said you were the best and I’ve been friends with her for 10 years, so I’m hoping there’s something that can be done with you here, somehow..someway.    So sweet, thank you for the kind words.  Colleen is awesome. 

Please let me know your thoughts and any additional info you may need to paint a better picture.    Please let me know when is a good time for you to further discuss.  When do you start your new job?  Which company and what position?  Will your husband be working as well?   

Thank you in advance,

The tentative feedback we received from our lending committee is concern with the purchase price for the subject lot. The main point they singled out is the fact that the property was listed at $1.6MM for 168 days in March 2022 and then cancelled and has now transacted for $3.075MM, nearly more than $1.0MM over assessed value. Given the valuation risk, the maximum they are comfortable with offering on the subject lot is $1.1MM, on the condition that Nitesh can produce documented evidence of the proceeds to complete on the purchase, and a copy of the deposit to be paid on completion a condition precedent. 

For clarity, this tentative offer would leave any non-subject property out of the financing and would not have any construction financing component - it is just to complete on the purchase. Please advise if Nitesh is prepared to proceed on this basis.

SV- HI Ifeyinwa, 


Happy Friday!   I just tried calling you.   Thank you for sending all the documents.   After review, in order for us to get the line of credit here are the documents the lender will require:


1.  The mortgage statement-  Must show if it is a running/collateral mortgage.   ( you will need to ask them to get a detail document to show this information)   My client was able to get this statement from the credit union.

2.  12 months of bank statements-  The NOA’s show a much lower income which the affordability ratios will not work for the lender.   By sending in the bank statements, we can use all deposits related to your business to show a higher income.   

3.  On your NOA’s there is a balance, did you pay your taxes?  

4. Property tax- If you are not able to get this, no worries.   We can work around this.   


Please let me know if you have any questions.   Thank you kindly and have a great weekend.

Selected Product: Classic Purchase/Refinance

Clients are looking to consolidate debt and remove friend from title. Looking for 80% LTV or max approval for possibility of a 2nd in the event of a shortfall.

Income: Anthony works at the University of Alberta as a Laboratory Assistant. He's been there for 10 years and his annual income is $47,086.84 calculated from his last 2 T4s. 
Angelica works for the Compass Group Canada as a Dining Supervisor. She has been there for 5 years and will be returning to work in March (doctors note and will get a job letter after manager is back Feb 15). Her income is calculated from her employment letter. 

They also both own a cleaning business. Income is calculated from business banking deposits less expenses. 

Credit story: Anthony has a strong payment history. Both Angelica and Anthony faced financial challenges during the pandemic, relying on loans and credit lines to cover essential expenses when their jobs couldn’t provide consistent hours. Unfortunately, things took a turn late last year when Angelica needed surgery and had to take a medical leave in October. This left her unable to keep up with her payments, significantly impacting her credit score. 

She’s set to return to work in March, but in the meantime, they’re hoping to refinance in order to consolidate their high-interest debt. By doing so, they'll be saving about $700/mo, which they can then redirect toward paying off their remaining debts. Remaining ETO will be put towards the rest of their debts as well. 

Please contact stephanie@bluepearlmortgage.ca / 604-372-2764 for any questions, thanks!

How do I exit the program?

To remove Liberty from your title, we would require the following information via email to sales@libertyhousingorganization.ca:

The original mortgage approval for your home.
A current home appraisal. You can find an appraiser here on the following website: https://www.aicanada.ca/need-an-appraiser/find-an-appraiser/

The shared equity amount, or
$5,000.00
(whichever is the greater value)

When we have calculated the payout amount, you can then get in touch with our solicitor.

Adrian

CCO - Decision not to file a report to FINTRAC was based on the following:

Lack of Evidence of Money Laundering (ML) or Terrorist Financing (TF):
The client is seeking to pull out equity to cover bills until she can secure full-time work and consistent income. The stated purpose aligns with personal financial needs, and no indicators of ML or TF activity were detected. The client’s identity was verified through an Equifax report pulled on 2024-12-10, with a unique CID number provided, and her date of birth matched the records.

Risk Level and Financial Background:
The client is assessed as medium to high risk due to a low credit score (below 500) with collections and charge-off accounts. While her boyfriend, who works in construction, employs her for admin/office work, her income is inconsistent, and she supplements it with side jobs. It was great speaking with you earlier. As discussed, here are the details regarding your mortgage options:
This will be a two-step process:
Challenges to consider:
Due to a balance owed to the CRA, we're unable to offer options with A lenders, such as TD or Scotiabank and other A lenders.

T1 generals for the last 2 years for the A side

B Lender Option:
Rates for B lenders start at 4.79% and may vary.
To qualify for this rate, you would need to show a minimum net income of $48,000 per year.
As mentioned, we will cover the cost of the appraisal if you decide to move forward with this transaction.
Please note: All offers are subject to change and approval.
Additionally, there are certain fees associated with mortgage transactions that we didn’t cover over the phone:
1% Lender Fee
1-2% Broker Fee
Appraisal Fee (minimum $425)
Blue Pearl Admin Fee: $500
Legal Fees (Do you have a lawyer in mind?)
If we secure a B lender approval, legal fees will depend on the lawyer you choose, typically around $1,500 (could be more or less).
For a private lender approval, there will be two sets of legal fees, approximately $1,500 each.
All fees will be deducted from the proceeds, you will not pay any fees out of pocket.   


Please let me know if you have any questions or if you’d like to proceed. I’m looking forward to building a lasting relationship with you, John.


Have a great weekend, and I’ll touch base with you on Monday.
